On 9/8/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
> >  Unless=
 I'm having a really brain dead Friday afternoon, this is the
> >  default =
behaviour of JUnit. All tests are run sequentially (order is
> >  undefined=
) and each test will complete (or fail) before the next one
> >  is started=
.
>
> If that is not correct then there are two of us having brain dead
> a=
fternoons :)
> It would take a considerably larger effort to make the tests=
 run
> concurrently.


I don't see why, it's fairly trivial to do with java=
.util.concurrent and it
can result in spectacular speed improvements (a Tes=
tNG user reported a 10x
increase in test running
times<http://groups.google=
.com/group/testng-users/browse_frm/thread/dff9feb2d28a59d0/d7861440ade6a01b=
?lnk=3Dgst&q=3Dparallel+speed+up&rnum=3D1#d7861440ade6a01b>when
they turned=
 the "parallel" flag on...).

-- 
C=E9dric
